So uhhh, this isn't the full game, I should have realized after seeing that it was only 3.96 GB, after you beat the character named Barret in this warehouse facility and you go to get in the helicopter (dunno what else to call it) to leave, first of all, you cant approach the helicopter but you can, if you wonder around it a bit, make the "enter" option appear and chose to leave, when you do, the helicopter takes off leaving a clone of itself behind, one of the many glitches, but what's even more strange is that the game just ends and brings you back to the main menu where you can then choose to continue or to load a game or what have you, I tried multiple time's to make it work but it doesn't, which tells me that this is not the full game but just like the first quarter of it.

To be honest it's still worth giving a shot, it's just a like a really really really long demo (hence the "Leaked Beta" in the name), I would definitely suggest giving it a try anyways, cause its a helluva game.

I'm playing it at the moment on my computer, a Pentium 4 D 2.66GHz machine with an ATI Radeon HD 4600 graphics card (below minimum specs), 2GB worth of RAM and Windows XP. So far the game plays well. The only real issue I've seen is in the cinematic movies, the subtitles are falling off the bottom of the screen and sometimes they get stuck when someone is talking to you so the subtitles no longer match the words. I've also noticed that Megan Reed has 5 copies of the same electronics book in her office, which seems a little odd, unless of course they're different editions.
I cant believe that some of you thought this was a full game.

To fix the Graphical Tear in the game, theres two things you can try that worked for me. save your game, close the game itself, and restart it. Load your game, and go into the Display options, and MANUALLY set your aspect ratio. (For me its 16:9). I can confirm that this works for me, and may work for others.

OK. I'm done downloading and playing it now.
Yep, it actually works. Quite nicely.

Yeah, I've always wondered how come some games come ''already installed'', how does this work?
After the first cutscene people in the game freeze including Adam, can anyone help me?

Update:

Found the problem, taking a screenshot with Fraps freezes Adam and all the motion in the game so avoid fraps as much as you can in this beta.

"Yeah, I've always wondered how come some games come ''already installed'', how does this work? "

Any game can be distributed this way really. 

The main reason why retail games have install routines is because the data is compressed. The installer expands the files and stores everything in the correct place. Another reason is to create any registry entries that may be necessary for the game to run, as well as automate other things like installing PunkBuster and the latest DirectX runtime.

This torrent contains a version of the game that is uncompressed, doesn't automatically install any dependancies and is designed to run independantly of any OS/registry settings.

Some people seem to be having problems installing this game so here is how i did it:-

Once downloaded move it into a seperate folder just so you can keep an eye on what is happening...extract it to the same folder...once that is done extract the 'crack' to the same folder and overwrite when prompted.

Now double click on the 'win7' exe....you got this new icon in the folder from the crack....play and have fun :).....the game doesnt install in the normal way like an ISO

Remember there are some bugs in the game because it is a beta and people will experience different ones...its just life and how things work out...for instance my aiming reticule sometimes isnt visible and another one is that once i am holding a weapon i sometimes cant put it away. Doesnt spoil the game though for me...its a small price to pay for the sheer joy of been able to play.

Huge thanks to Amputate for uploading this game :)

@ Syn.wtf

You say you almost meet the specs needed apart from your CPU...that is where your problem lies.

Most modern games are CPU heavy...if your CPU is below spec and also couple that with a bare min spec graphics card you will run into problems and no amount of tinkering will solve it.

You could have the best motherboard in the world and the best graphics card but if your CPU is as dumb as a box of spanners it doesnt matter how much the rest of your system tries to tell it what to do it is incapable of doing it because it isnt brainy enough.

By the way im not having a dig at you im just trying to explain that you are asking your pc to do something it just hasnt a clue how to and never will...time to open the wallet and upgrade my friend :)

Peace

The game works, although partway in I experienced recurring crashes that I could not solve. Perhaps there is a way, but I couldn't achieve it. Game is fun though, and playable at least until halfway through at which point I could no longer bring myself to keep restarting the game from the recurring crashes
@lolponed Go in your nvidia panel and change everything to performance instead of quality to get a higher fps.  Also, turn vertical sync off.  You should look in to upgrading your ram as well.
